Case reference: 2006008799.CaseDesc: Doris Fennell was last observed at the home of an acquaintace in Kitley-Elizabeth Township, near Addison, Ontario. Foul Play is strongly suspected in her disappearance.

Case reference: 2014042438.CaseDesc: On November 17, 2014, at approximately 6:00 p.m., Delaram Hashemi was seen for the last time leaving her home in Toronto, Ontario. Delaram had told her mother that she would be attending a party and would return home at 10:00 p.m., but she never returned.

Case reference: 2012020131.CaseDesc: Gilles Parisien, 53, was reported missing October 28, 2003. A witness claims to have seen him on October 9, 2003 in Malartic. At the time of his disappearance, he was at the Malartic Hospital Center.

Case reference: 2019068654.CaseDesc: On November 16, 2019, Lara Parkin was seen for the last time in the South-West District of Montreal, Quebec. Lara is known to frequent Montreal’s downtown area and parks. She is also known to travel by foot or by public transit. During the time of her disappearance, Lara left her apartment without bringing any of her belongings.

Case reference: 2016044292.CaseDesc: Chenel Dubé was last seen on August 10, 1970 in Montreal, Quebec. That evening, he called his mother to tell her that he would be home later. Chenel's vehicle was found 3 days later in the parking lot of a restaurant in Ville Saint-Laurent, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014006160.CaseDesc: On November 28, 1978, George Heys left his residence for an appointment in Toronto, Ontario. George has not been seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014005039.CaseDesc: On October 28, 1983, Azim Ramji was seen for the last time as he left his home in Kitchener, Ontario, after telling his family that he was leaving for Niagara Falls. Later that day, Azim’s vehicle was found at the Skylon Tower in Niagara Falls, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Azim was despondent.

Case reference: 2016068415.CaseDesc:
On July 17, 1975 a "Hush Puppy" style loafer shoe, size 10, containing a skeletonized left foot was found on the south shore of the Ottawa River in Chute a Blondeau, Ontario. The colour of the shoe is not discernible. 
Examination of the foot bones by a Forensic Pathologist revealed that this individual may be a male, aged 20-50 years, 5'10" to 6'1" in height, 200-230 lbs., with no abnormalities of the foot bones and no arthritis. The Forensic Pathologist had estimated that death occurred in excess of one year to possibly 5 years.

Case reference: 2016068950.CaseDesc: On March 2, 1978, a Caucasian male jumped off the Municipal Parking Garage, 65 Pitt Street East, Windsor. Prior to jumping he had told an observer that his name was Lester, that he was depressed and had been in the hospital.

Case reference: 2014006465.CaseDesc: On January 18, 2014, Sofi Ma was seen for the last time with her father, Moses Ma, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001464.CaseDesc: On the evening of August 16, 1989, Vincent Greene entered a wooded area behind his residence on the Red Head Rd, Saint John, NB, to search for the family dog. The dog returned shortly after he had left, but Vincent never returned.  An extensive ground search was conducted with negative results. Anyone with information is urged to contact the Saint John Police Force.

Glasses: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Steel rimmed
Jewelry: Gold, Wedding Ring, Lines on both sides

Case reference: 2008019699.CaseDesc: On April 10, 2006 Mohmud Jiwani left his residence in Oakville to attend a business meeting in Toronto. He never returned to his Oakville residence. His vehicle was later located in the Jarvis and Dundas area of Toronto. Despite an extensive investigation, no further information has been uncovered regarding his disappearance.

Pants: Dark Blue, Navy blue suit pants

Case reference: 2014004798.CaseDesc: On the 25th of October, 1954, Tersilla Bonthoux, 79 years old, was last seen walking from Duck Lake towards the farm homestead where she used to reside, approximately 13 km away. Ms. Bonthoux was reported missing and extensive searches of the area failed to locate any trace of her.

Case reference: 2006012999.CaseDesc: Joshua Kennet was last seen in the water after the boat he was riding in overturned on Grayson Lake, Ontario on October 13, 1995. Joshua is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2013000029.CaseDesc: On November 4, 1991, Montreal Police received a complaint from Mr. Katnick reporting that his daughter Leslie Anne Katnick was missing. Leslie Katnick had been residing in Montreal, Quebec until November 1, 1991, which was the last time she was seen by either friends or family. The investigation revealed that a Leslie Katnick registered into the Halifax YMCA on November 2, 1991, for several nights and returned the key on November 4, 1991. No further information has surfaced with respect to the whereabouts of Leslie Katnick. The circumstances of her disappearance are suspicious and foul play may be involved.

Case reference: 2005001599.CaseDesc: Shawn Jones and Leslie Jones were seen on October 24, 1993. The two boys were hitchhiking from Cape Croker to Wiarton. They were dropped off in downtown Wiarton. Between October 26-28, 1993 Leslie Jones was seen with another male fitting the description of Shawn Jones. They were seen together at the Tim Hortons coffee shop in Owen Sound, Ontario. Shawn Jones was last seen on Berford Street in front of Pacific Hotel. Leslie Jones was last seen in front of the Tim Horton's restaurant on 9th East Street.

Case reference: 2015020929.CaseDesc: On April 27, 2015, Andrzej Popek was last seen at the Crawford Lake Conservation Area in Milton, Ontario.  Andrzej's abandoned vehicle was located the following day in the Conservation's parking lot.

Case reference: 2012020129.CaseDesc: Nadine Lussier and Dominic Gauthier worked at a convenience store in Ste-Sophie. They were seen for the last time Wednesday, June 16th 2004. They left the convenience store around 3:00 p.m., and were then seen in a Prévost restaurant. Ms.Lussier's vehicle had not moved from the restaurant from the evening of Wednesday, June 16th 2004 and the time Dominic Gauthier's mother reported their disappearance on Friday June 18th 2004.

Case reference: 2020009419.CaseDesc: On August 6, 1989, at approximately 12:00pm, Jessica Sakouhi was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Jessica was visiting from France and was due to return back on August 19, but she did not board the plane.

Case reference: 2013000095.CaseDesc: On October 19, 1969 Ronald Bonkowski went fishing with two friends in the Winnipeg River. Upon arriving at their desired location, the party anchored their boat in fast moving water. The anchor caught on the bottom of the river and pulled the boat down, causing it to over turn. All three men were thrown into the water. Two of the men were able to swim to the shore, however Mr. Bonkowski was observed going under the water. The over turned boat was found with an anchor line attached at the dam site. Searches were conducted by water and land, however Ronald Bonkowski was never located. He is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014002695.CaseDesc: Harold Wagner was last seen on June 4, 1988, at Fur Lake in the Mont Nebo district, SK. Mr. Wagner was swimming from his boat when he disappeared.

Shorts: Cloth, White, Red, White swim trunks with red, blue and red stripes

Case reference: 2014001428.CaseDesc: On May 19, 1998, at approximately 7:00 p.m., Rémi Engrand left a residence for men in Valleyfield, Quebec, for a walk with two other residents of the center where he had been staying for a few days. They went to the Delpha-Sauvé Park, where Rémi wanted to go swimming in the river, near the waterfall. The three separated, leaving Rémi alone and when they returned, they found Rémi’s clothes on the shoreline. The current in this section of the river is very fast and the presence of the falls makes swimming very risky. Rémi has not been seen since this time.

Case reference: 2019012891.CaseDesc: Dean Brett Todd was last seen by his brother, around Easter time in 2000, near First Memorial Services Kamloops (formerly Schoening Funeral Home) on Tranquille Road in Kamloops, British Columbia. Dean had been invited to dinner, but did not show up. Dean is known to travel between Kamloops and Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014005011.CaseDesc: On July 28, 2005, at approximately 6:15 p.m., Senekinesh Qirma was seen for the last time at the Eaton Centre in Toronto, Ontario. Senekinesh was in Canada on a visitor’s visa.

Case reference: 2014031015.CaseDesc: A male was located, deceased in a wooded area near the Halifax International Airport. No identification was located in the area. A composite sketch and reconstruction model of the male have been developed, however the male remains unidentified.

Case reference: 2014003528.CaseDesc: Mrs. Huyghe was reported missing after she had not returned home. Police investigations regarding Mrs. Huyghe are ongoing and her whereabouts remain unknown.

Boots: Leather, Black, winter boot with suede fur tops
Jewelry: Metal, Gold, family ring with colored stone

Case reference: 2019043636.CaseDesc: On May 6, 1994, the skeletal remains of a man were found in a well on agricultural land on rang du Côteau in St-Charles-sur-Richelieu, Quebec.

Jewelry: Gold, Gold, 10K gold, wedding band, inscription "TNR ORA"
Belt: Leather, Black, With buckle, length 32 inches
Shirt: Cotton and polyester shirt with long sleeves, size 16-33

Case reference: 2014003620.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1980, Arthur Keefe was travelling with a friend on snowmobile when the pair went through the ice and into the water. His friend managed to climb out, but Mr. Keefe went under and it is not known whether he resurfaced.

Case reference: 2005003999.CaseDesc: On December 19, 1990, a Caucasian male was found on a park bench at George Brown College near 147 Baldwin Avenue, Toronto. This male may have been a smoker. His appendix is present and he has a left-sided hernia of the diaphragm.

Hair: Brown, Short, grey beard and moustache
Money: Copper, Several pennies were found in his pocket.
Boots: Brown, vinyl ankle boot with side zipper
Mark: Right Leg, small ulcers and bruises
Left Leg, small ulcers and bruises
Amputation: Left Ring Finger, missing the tip

Case reference: 2014001023.CaseDesc: On August 3, 1998, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Fraser River in Delta, British Columbia. The man’s body was found in the south end of the Fraser Surrey Docks Ltd and it is estimated that he may have possibly died between October 1997 and April 1998.

Jewelry: Wood, Brown, Black, Necklace, 1.5" Cross on cord
Shirt: Cloth, Black, Blue, T Shirt, Brand Bugle Boy
Jacket: Cloth, Tan, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Winter, Down filled, purple inside
Pants: Denim, Blue, IKEDA, Brand Marks & Spencer
Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running, Brand Reebok, size 9

Case reference: 2006028299.CaseDesc: Shawn McConkey was last seen leaving work on December 21, 2001. That same day, his vehicle was involved in a single vehicle collision on County Road #22 in Otonabee-South Monaghan Township. No one was located at the scene of the accident. A search of the area has failed to locate Mr. McConkey and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Shirt: Denim, Blue, Emblem over left pocket and name over right pocket
Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Picture of a skull and the word "Tom"
Right Hand, Trees and a cross
Right Upper Arm , Picture of Hitler

Case reference: 2013000099.CaseDesc: William Andersen and a co-worker were designated to conduct a wildlife survey in northern Manitoba. The men had flown into North Indian Lake on June 26th and departed by canoe from there. On the second day when the men attempted to shoot some rapids, their canoe hit a rock which overturned, throwing both men into the river. Mr. Andersen was not seen again. Air and land searches failed to locate Mr. Andersen and he is presumed dead as a result of drowning. No foul play is suspected in this matter.

Scar: 1" long scar 3/8" wide on the back of either the left or right hand.

Case reference: 2012020017.CaseDesc: Stephen Begg was reported missing February 16, 2011.  Mr. Begg struggled with alcoholism and depression.

Case reference: 2017073558.CaseDesc: On June 18, 2016, an unidentified man was found at the “St. Basil-the-Great College School” in Toronto, Ontario. The man had previously identified himself as John Doe, and biogeographic ancestry testing predicts that he was of East Asian ancestry.

Foreign Object: Lower Back, Fragments of old bullet in lumbar
Scar: Left Thigh, Round scar on left lateral thigh
Left Buttocks, Puckered scar on left posterior thigh
Middle Back, Mid-back on the left side
Chest, Scar in the left and right axillas
Right Chest, Scar on right nipple

Case reference: 2018041254.CaseDesc: On July 10, 2018, Ashley Morin was last seen leaving a house, on foot, in North Battleford, Saskatchewan

Case reference: 2014001105.CaseDesc: The skeletal remains of a man were found along with camping gear in a wooded area near Chute Lake, BC in November 1991. He had a chip in one front tooth. It is estimated that he may have died several years prior to the discovery of his remains.

Jacket: Wool, Black, Suit coat, Herringbone pattern
Shirt: Cotton, Blue, White, Button-down Lumberman flannel
Shoes: Leather, Brown, Lace-up dress shoes, re-soled

Case reference: 2014002416.CaseDesc: On May 5, 1983, Desmond Runstedler was believed to be travelling to Ontario and was last seen standing on the side of Highway #13 near Lougheed, AB.  His personal items were left at his residence.

Case reference: 2014001761.CaseDesc: Henrietta Mille is originally from Nain, Newfoundland and had been living in St. John’s, Newfoundland for quite some time before her disappearance. Henrietta was known to frequent the clubs in the St. John’s downtown area. Her keys, purse and other belongings were found at the Key Club.

Case reference: 2012020067.CaseDesc: At the time of her disappearance she was a ward of Brandon Mental health Centre and it is believed that she walked out of the facility on her own the day of her disappearance.  She may have had a tattoo on her forearm.

Jacket: Cream, Ivory, With green and brown

Case reference: 2014002472.CaseDesc: In April 1988, Stacey Rogers was seen for the last time as she left her residence in Taylor, British Columbia. Stacey had stated that she was planning on travelling to Edmonton, Alberta, but did not go to Edmonton. It is possible that she went to Grande Prairie, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014002241.CaseDesc: In April of 1972, Velma Marie Duncan was last seen by her brother hitchhiking from the Gang Ranch area to Williams Lake, BC. Ms. Duncan arrived at her sister’s residence and attended the downtown core of Williams Lake with her sister on May 3rd or 4th, 1972. Ms. Duncan entered a local bar, which was the last time she was seen.

Case reference: 2018016267.CaseDesc: Yvette Bourgon was seen for the last time in Montreal on approximately January 1, 1965. Mrs. Bourgon was hospitalized at Louis-H Lafontaine, formerly known as St-Jean-de-Dieu. Mrs. Bourgon's footprints were found in the snow near the Lachine Canal in Verdun. Her purse was found without her wallet in close proximity to the footprints.

Case reference: 2014005512.CaseDesc: On October 4, 2010, Ivana Ferus was seen for the last time as she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario, to catch a flight destined for the Czech Republic. Ivana’s apartment keys were subsequently found in a recycling bin.

Case reference: 2016066832.CaseDesc: On August 14, 1978, a body was recovered from the Detroit River. The body is believed to be that of a female. American money was found in the pockets of the pants. This person is believed to have been dead for several weeks to months.

Case reference: 2018005079.CaseDesc: Joshua Hawkins was last seen on January 28, 2018, at approximately 6pm when he left the Brockville General Hospital without being discharged.

Tattoo: Right Calf, Lion and dragon with the word Kaitlyn
Right Upper Arm , Outline of a heart
Right Leg, Skull and hand holding a flame - on the front of the leg

Case reference: 2014004308.CaseDesc: Joseph Laboucan was last seen in Peace River, Alberta, on or around August 10, 1998. He lived on the streets in Peace River and Little Buffalo, Alberta. He made occasional trips around the area as far as Edmonton.

Case reference: 2014005574.CaseDesc: Judy Chescue was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in October 1988.  Judy was last seen near her home in Edmonton in July 1988.

Case reference: 2013000070.CaseDesc: On June 4, 1980, Serge Jobin was seen for the last time in the De Lorimier district of Montreal, Quebec. He may have taken a bus to New York City in the United States. Serge is hearing impaired and mute.

Case reference: 2018060326.CaseDesc: On June 10, 2018, sisters Bérénice and Bérengère Paré were last seen at the Ottawa International Airport in Ottawa, Ontario. Bérénice and Bérengère, along with their mother, boarded a flight destined for Russia to visit with family. To date, the siblings have not been returned to Canada.

Case reference: 2014005327.CaseDesc: Edward Tandrup was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta in February of 1983. Edward Tandrup may have been hitchiking to Vancouver, BC at the time.

Case reference: 2014004969.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1966, a friend asked Ronnie Harper to help him lift one of his nets out of the waters of Red Sucker Lake. The two men set off in a canoe. When they arrived at the site, the men pulled the line attached to the net, but it didn't move. Increasing their efforts, the men pulled harder and the line attached to the weight came loose. The sudden shift caused both men to lose their footing and the canoe to overturn. The men attempted to move closer to shore by pushing the canoe. After a time, Mr. Harper told his friend he was too tired to hold on any longer. His companion continued moving the canoe. The survivor then realized Mr. Harper was no longer hanging on. Efforts to locate Mr. Harper were unsuccessful and it is presumed he drowned.

Case reference: 2014003430.CaseDesc: Alim Hasan was last seen by his mother in Burnaby on March 21, 1990, when he was returning to his residence in Edmonton via Grey Hound Bus. Alim had a history of mental illness. On April 6, 1990, an unknown person left one of Alim’s luggage at the front door of Hope RCMP Detachment.

Luggage: Synthetic, Red, White, Sports Bag, Red Sports bag with white trim

Case reference: 2012020091.CaseDesc: On May 26, 1982, a body was found floating in the South Saskatchewan River near Rosthern, SK. The body may have been in the water for up to 9 months. All efforts to identify this person have failed. In 2004, the remains were exhumed and a further examination completed resulting in the above description of this person.

Belt: Leather, Black, Caswell, money belt; size 34

Case reference: 2014002598.CaseDesc: Tina Fang Chen arrived in Canada from China in May 2000 and stayed in Mississauga Ontario for approximately 3 weeks, until her disappearance on June 9, 2000.  It is believed that she had the intention to enter the USA and was possibly headed for New York State.

Case reference: 2014000015.CaseDesc: On March 28, 2012 Allan Kinkaid was reported missing to the Calgary Police Service. Mr. Kinkaid had moved to Las Vegas, Nevada in 2006. He last had contact with his family in Calgary on December 25, 2009.

Hair: Brown, Straight, Other, Blonde patch, medium length

Case reference: 2014004086.CaseDesc: On July 13,1981, Sophia Armstrong was seen for the last time. Her companion reported that she had gone on a trip, which was out of character for Ms. Armstrong.

Case reference: 2021059908.CaseDesc: On June 16, 2016, the partial remains of an unidentified man were recovered in Renews, Newfoundland. Between 2016 and 2018, additional remains belonging to this man were recovered.

Case reference: 2017048277.CaseDesc: On August 20, 2017 at 11:00 pm, Christina Cooper was last seen leaving her boyfriend's residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004770.CaseDesc: At approximately 11:00 p.m. on April 17, 2006, Sangeeta Khanna called a family member and told him that she was going to stop at the bank and then would be home shortly. In the morning when she did not arrive the police were called. Her vehicle was located abandoned in a parking lot in Edmonton and she has not been seen since. The investigation is ongoing and investigators believe that Sangeeta may be the victim of foul play.

Case reference: 2014004211.CaseDesc: On August 24, 1987, Louis Haineault, 48 years old, was last seen heading out in a boat to fish on Cree Lake, north of Buffalo Narrows, SK. Searchers located his boat and fishing nets, however the boat was inoperable. Searches of the area failed to locate Mr. Haineault.

Case reference: 2014001487.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1995, Raymond Snakeskin was last seen in Wollaston Lake, SK. He had told another individual that he was making a pilgrimage to Zangeza Bay on Reindeer Lake, approximately 60 kilometers through the bush. Mr. Snakeskin has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020097.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1986, Corrine Moosomin, 25 years old, was last seen at approximately 4:00 a.m. on the Saulteaux First Nation near North Battleford, SK. She was last seen walking on a grid road. Corrine was reported missing and extensive searches failed to locate her.

Case reference: 2014004320.CaseDesc: On February 22, 2002, Alexandre Fortin was seen for the last time in a home situated on road 127 in Saint-Georges, Quebec. Over the course of the night, a fire completely destroyed the residence and Alexandre remains missing, despite search operations.

Case reference: 2018054176.CaseDesc: On February 15, 1992, at approximately 10:00pm, Adu Frimpong was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001355.CaseDesc: Mr. Aurèle Massey was last seen on August 8, 1983 in Montreal. He left his residence to have his vehicle repaired, but never returned. Mr. Massey was despondent and had mentioned that he wanted to jump into the Soulanges Canal.

Case reference: 2012020136.CaseDesc: Guy Verdon has been missing since March 24, 2010. On that day, he went to his daughter’s residence in Charlemagne, Quebec. He left her residence around 7:00 pm and was never seen again. Guy's associate, François Robillard also disappeared around the same time.

Teeth: False, Had partials, top and bottom
Watch: Gold, Gold, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Raymond Weil brand, two-tone bracelet
Chain: Gold, Gold, Pendant, medallion of the Holy Virgin
Amputation: Left Middle Finger, Tip of middle finger amputated

Case reference: 2014001136.CaseDesc: On June 18, 1998, the body of a woman in a state of advanced decomposition believed to be between the ages of 30-49, was found near a dock on Charron Island located in the St. Lawrence River near Longueuil, Quebec. Her body would have been in the water for a number of months.

Scar: Abdomen, Scar from appendectomy, lower right side

Case reference: 2014001943.CaseDesc: Kam Lee was last seen in the Bishop Grandin and River Road area of Winnipeg, MB.  Mr. Lee's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2016068333.CaseDesc: This left humerus (upper arm bone) was located in approximately 47 feet of water and 19 minutes from the shore in the Niagara River, approximately 1 km north of East/West Line in Niagara-on-the-Lake. Dive teams failed to locate any further remains. The bone is from a male, possibly black. The remains have been in the water for an extended period of time (5 to 25 years).

Case reference: 2018056491.CaseDesc: On March 10, 1994, at approximately 6:15pm, Gallus Huber was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Gallus was scheduled to attend a language class but did not show up.

Case reference: 2017073542.CaseDesc: On November 4, 2016, an unidentified man was discovered in Lake Ontario in St. Catharines, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he was of East Asian Ancestry.

Case reference: 2014005439.CaseDesc: John Sparrow was last seen in April or May of 2001, getting into an early 1990s black Chevrolet pick-up truck while accompanied by an unknown male driver. Mr. Sparrow and the unknown man left the parking lot of the Denny's restaurant located at Benson Ave and Division St, in the city of Kingston, Ontario and headed north past highway #401.

Case reference: 2022001276.CaseDesc: On December 31, 2021, Emily Bailey was seen for the last time in Hamilton, Ontario. Emily is known to live a transient lifestyle, but is also known to remain in constant contact with her friends and family via social media. All of her social media activity has stopped since December 27, 2021.

Backpack: Light Blue, Black, Has black handles

Case reference: 2012020185.CaseDesc: Remains of this adult male were located on the shore of Lake Kamloops, approximately 19 kilometers west of Kamloops.

Teeth: False, Had no teeth. Only a lower denture was recovered which had dark brown stain, likely tobacco.
Pants: Other, Off-white, Canvas full length pants

Case reference: 2014003815.CaseDesc: Monica Cardinal was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in February, 1997. Monica was last seen leaving a downtown hotel with an unknown male in June, 1993.

Case reference: 2006004799.CaseDesc: Ralph Monague and Curtis Smith were passengers on the Christian Island Ferry travelling between Cedar Point and Christian Island on December 22, 1985, when they fell over board in stormy conditions.

Case reference: 2014003548.CaseDesc: On October 4, 1996, Billy Taylor was dropped off at a treatment facility in St. Norbert. Billy departed the centre in the evening prior to being processed. There have been a few reported sightings of Billy, however no one has had any contact with him since 1996. Billy Taylor's whereabouts remain unknown.

Jacket: Leather, Black, Canadian flag on back

Case reference: 2012000299.CaseDesc: Investigators with York Regional Police Homicide Unit are seeking assistance from the public in their investigation into the disappearance of a 45 year old woman. Cheryl Rowe was last seen by her family on December 22, 2011, just after midnight on Rathfon Crescent in the Town of Richmond Hill. The investigation is still ongoing and investigators believe that Ms. Rowe may be the victim of foul play.

Tattoo: Upper Back, children's names, two wings with the words "Shane" and "Christina"

Case reference: 2006025799.CaseDesc: Anthony Roberts was last seen driving his vehicle east on King Street in Prescott, Ontario, on January 8, 1996. He was reported missing on January 19, 1996, and has not been heard from or seen since that time.

Case reference: 1994001800.CaseDesc: On the evening of August 5, 1989, Casey Bohun was seen for the last time by her mother when she was put to bed in her home in Delta, British Columbia. Prior to her disappearance, Casey and her family had recently moved to this area, and she was not familiar with the neighbourhood. Today, Casey may not realize that she was abducted as a child.

Case reference: 2008019999.CaseDesc: Patrick O’Connell has been missing since July 4, 2008. He was last seen by a friend and roommate. Patrick suffers from schizophrenia, substance abuse issues, and has previously made comments that he may harm himself.

Case reference: 2018043194.CaseDesc: On July 13, 1990, Laura Hamilton was last seen by her fiancé leaving a restaurant in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005633.CaseDesc: On July 7, 2011, Dillon Mcmaster had been swimming in the Bow River in Alberta with a group of friends. Dillon was caught in a current, pulled under and was not seen again. Multiple efforts to locate Dillon were negative and he is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2020008363.CaseDesc: On August 16, 1981, at approximately 1:00pm, Dick Yeagar was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Dick had been evicted from his apartment on August 15, and did not show up to work the following day.

Case reference: 2006026699.CaseDesc: On May 22, 1967, at about 10:30 a.m. Mr. Sauder was fishing with friends in Bouillon Lake, Calvin Township, District of Nipissing, in a twelve foot aluminum boat. He stood up and the boat capsized. Mr. Sauder could not swim and was not wearing a life jacket.

Case reference: 2005002199.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1980, a Caucasian male was found at a campsite (Lot 19, Con 8, Peck Township) on Hardwood Lookout Trail in Algonquin Park. The death is estimated to have occurred between July 1, 1971 and Spring 1978.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Possibly in a ponytail
Wallet: Black, with 8 cent stamp issues between July 1, 1971 and September 1, 1976
Other: A folding camp stove; and an aluminum camper's pot with a lid
A black down-filled sleeping bag with a nylon outer shell
Belt: 36 inch, wear shown at 32 inch hole

Case reference: 2014004467.CaseDesc: On November 16, 1997, Sadhi, Samia, Samir, and Saeed Jiredeh were last seen as they left their home with their father in Toronto, Ontario. That day, their parents had gotten into an argument prior to them leaving.

Case reference: 2014001952.CaseDesc: On September 19, 1980, James Neckoway and a friend left Bird, Manitoba by canoe to go hunting and fishing. They intended to travel down the Limestone River, and then down the Nelson River. The canoe in which the men were travelling and the body of Mr. Neckoway's friend were recovered on September 23. Mr. Neckoway has not been located and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014001782.CaseDesc: On May 2, 1972, Kenneth Kay was seen for the last time as he attended the First Nation Treaty days in Quinton, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2012020654.CaseDesc: On May 12, 1997, Darold Kishayinew was last seen at a relative’s house in Regina, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2014006747.CaseDesc: Jian Ping Li and her 6 month old baby, Xiao Feng Lu, were last seen at their family residence in Brossard on April 30, 2014, around 9:40 a.m. When her husband returned, around 2:30 p.m., there was nobody home and the back door was unlocked.  Ms. Li's car was still at the residence. She left without her purse, her wallet, money, her credit card, and her cell phone, the diaper bag for the baby, the baby stroller and the car seat.

Case reference: 2012020101.CaseDesc: William Gill was last seen in the early morning hours of December 21, 1981, leaving an apartment on Appleby Drive in Saskatoon, SK. Mr. Gill had been out earlier that evening at a local nightclub with his co-worker.

Case reference: 2014006302.CaseDesc: On November 4, 2013, Gaetan Ethier was last seen when he was on a ferry crossing the Ottawa River towards Quebec. He has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2021037665.CaseDesc: On August 24, 2021 Donald Preston was reported missing in Quesnel, British Columbia and was last seen on July 31, 2021 in Kersley, British Columbia. It is possible that Donald may have travelled east to New Brunswick.

Case reference: 2018040305.CaseDesc: On the morning of April 10, 2001, Joo Youn was seen for the last time as she sent her children off to school in Toronto, Ontario. Later that day, when Joo’s husband returned home she was gone and she had left a note.

Case reference: 2011001499.CaseDesc: At the time of his disappearance, Luke Joly-Durocher was visiting friends in North Bay, Ontario. He resides in Temiskaming, Quebec. Video surveillance showed Luke being refused entry into Cecil's Eatery and Beer Society at approximately 11:54 p.m. He left by himself and has not been seen or heard from since that time.

Shirt: Grey, T-shirt, may have had a small purple animal logo on the bottom corner
Belt: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Black, Studded belt, black on the front and purple around the waist
Deformity: Right Forearm, Thinner than left forearm

Case reference: 2021000674.CaseDesc: On December 30, 2020, Tyler Desorcy was seen for the last time in the 900 block of Pandora Avenue in Victoria, British Columbia. Tyler has no fixed address and he has not been seen or heard from by his family, which is out of character for him.  Tyler is known to walk with a notable limp.

Hair: Brown, Dark brown receeding hair with some facial hair

Case reference: 2014004087.CaseDesc: On October 31, 1996, James Withers was last seen at his family's residence.

Case reference: 2012020053.CaseDesc: Jennifer Catcheway has been missing since Thursday June 19, 2008. Ms. Catcheway was seen at approximately 12:00 pm leaving Grand Rapids en route to Portage la Prairie, Manitoba.  During her travels it is believed that she was dropped off near the Waterhen junction - Provincial Road 328 and PTH #6. Ms. Catcheway has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004742.CaseDesc: On January 9, 2006, Michael James Bosma left on foot from a care home located on Bernard Avenue in Kelowna, BC and failed to return.  Mr. Bosma had been diagnosed with schizophrenia and required essential medication.  ATM activity was recorded on his account during the night and early morning hours following his departure then all traces of him ceased.
